content: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING GAME

I hate to rate this low, artstyle is interesting, has cool light puzzles, gameplay is part stealth and exploration with artistic and horror feel. Not to mention I havent gotten far in the game (level 2), but Stairs! Dont get me wrong, controls work fine with three choices but for some reason stairs (running full tilt) movement slows to a crawl and seems to stop or fall back walking. Its stopped my forward mementum and I payed for this! Dont want refund, I Hope its fixed as it seems really great!
Me and my daughter played Fracter together and loved it. Such good level design and sound. Well worth the purchase, this is a must play game.
The game doesnt mute.
this girl has a serious problem going upstairs! goodlooking game but this seriously impedes game progress. tok aggravating to deal with.
replyContent:
Hi Proverbs, 
I heard you're having a bit of trouble with the character going up the stairs. Do you mind giving us a bit more information on which part you're experiencing this concern? If you don't mind sending an email to contact@4lgames.com, thank you!

content: boring game with bad controls
missing adaptive launcher icon

The game is sparse yet beautiful at the same time. Think monument valley except more austere. The flaws in the game are that the puzzles are a bit too easy (sometimes solving themselves) and that the collectables are also too easy to collect. Also, I find the pushing animation is a bit wonky and that the colored dots found in the voids clash with the black and white aesthetics. Otherwise, this game is worth to play if you have time.

I just started playing but I had to leave a review because so far Iam very much enjoying this, the atmosphere is wonderful and almost ethereal, sound effects are lovely and not too overbearing and the poetic nature of the story is engaging. I hope that the entire game is like this

Really wanted to like this but am a bit disappointed. (1) Performance is poor even on medium graphics settings on a modern device. I notice the latest update says they improved performance--I can't imagine how bad it was before! (2) Controls feel sludgy and imprecise. This could be due to issue #1, and thankfully they do include multiple control options. (3) There are some gameplay issues/bugs. They're mostly minor, but they are present (4) Game is fairly short. (5) Puzzles are a tad too easy.
Wow what a beautiful game! A fun puzzler having to do with light and dark. Very well done, not usually a fan of these types of games but I'm digging this a lot. Totally worth the price!

A beautifully put together game that's a little on the short side, but makes up for it with loads of great atmosphere. The graphics and animations are lovely, and the puzzles are challenging (but not impossible). The controls can be a tiny bit frustrating at times, but I got used to them quite quickly and this minor issue doesn't detract from the brilliant experience for me. If you enjoy games like Monument Valley (and aren't put off by a darker theme), I highly recommend giving this a try.

Absolutely immersive experience -- the graphics, music, effects all go seamlessly well together. I recommend playing this in a dark room at night on a tablet or chromebook for a bigger screen experience!
too short, but its ok. the game is well executed and very artistic
Ggggggggrrttreat
Horrible, please refund my $$$

This game was so frustrating to play. The controls were difficult and the 
game itself was buggy. Monument Valley was a good game but this game seemed 
rushed and didn't contain the most interesting elements (optical illusions) 
that MV had.

Puzzles were not that hard, and kinda short for the $$ paid. Good 
atmosphere and sounds
Way too short, not worth the money at all.
Fun game with a tinge of horror. Volume up for gameplay
Very low resolution even on highest setting

A visually stunning and atmospheric game that gives you enough context to 
build a world, but not enough to make you feel wholly comfortable in it, 
making you push on to not only find what you're looking for, but uncover 
what else can be discovered. Performance (no issues), audio (wear 
headphones!), and controls with alternative options (I suggest floating 
joystick) are well implemented and give polish to this experience. For 
anyone who ever enjoyed Flower, Journey, Sky, Abzu or Monument Valley 1 and 
2, this game is both artful and well made. It is a fitting addition to 
these types of games. Great work, devs.
Beautiful visually and has wonderful gameplay.

Played the game for a few minutes now, and wow, this game is already 
amazing. Beautiful visuals and amazing audio! I play this with my B&W p5 2 
series headphones, which makes the experience surreal due to the amazing 
audio and high end headphones! Highly advised to play with a decent pair of 
headphones to enjoy this game at is best !

Wish there were more levels. I love the mood set by the artwork, but game 
over too soon.

Intriguing game with fab graphics. Music compliments the atmosphere, love 
puzzle solving games. Give it a try!
Beautiful and engaging game. Love it.

Really fun puzzle game with interesting and tense interactions throughout. 
Wear headphones and get in to it

Fun little puzzle game that gets a little hampered by the controls at 
times, but in general plays really well and looks beautiful!

Decent gameplay is unfortunately overly hampered by poor controls. This 
would be better with a physical gamepad, but it's not a great experience 
from a phone.
replyContent:
Hey Michael!


We have alternative control options in the menu located in the upper right hand corner. There you can pick three different settings to fit your playing style. :)
